info.description: Network exploration tool and security/port scanner. Some features (e.g. SYN scan) activate only when `nmap` is run with root privileges.

commands.nmap -v1|2|3 ip_or_hostname: Scan the top 1000 ports of a remote host with various [v]erbosity levels
commands.nmap -T5 -sn 192.168.0.0/24|ip_or_hostna: Run a ping sweep over an entire subnet or individual hosts very aggressively
commands.nmap -p port1,port2,... ip_or_host1,ip_o: Scan a specific list of ports (use `-p-` for all ports from 1 to 65535)
commands.nmap -sC -sV -oA top-1000-ports ip_or_ho: Perform service and version detection of the top 1000 ports using default NSE scripts, writing results (`-oA`) to output files
commands.nmap --script \"default and safe\" ip_or: Scan target(s) carefully using `default and safe` NSE scripts
commands.nmap --script \"http-*\" ip_or_host1,ip_: Scan for web servers running on standard ports 80 and 443 using all available `http-*` NSE scripts
